message: I go back and forth between representing it as a string, and just using epoch time
I use strings, but I would consider using epoch time.
I also use strings to represent date/time. I find the added benefit of (human) readable documents to be worth the extra parsing step.
it uses the fact that "\/hi\/" and "/hi/" are equivalent to achieve bulletproof serialization...misses the point imo
not a fan of Microsoft's JSON date/time representation
